title.rendered: The Women Contractors of Sweeten, Part 5

content.rendered:
Support women general contractors with experience and who are building their contracting firms in our network

In honor of Women’s History month, we are spotlighting women general contractors in the general contracting field. These Sweeten contractors are leading the charge and closing the gender gap.

With years of experience under their belts, their firms include experts who handle a myriad of projects—from residential room remodels and full-home renovations to commercial work.

In the last of a five-part series, we feature women contractors who have the skills and industry knowledge to make your home-sweet-home a reality.

Sweeten General Contractor Emily | Long Island, NY

General contractor Emily and her partner, Cristhian, focus on entire home renovation projects. They oversee a team of expert craftsmen whose objective is to deliver high-quality construction services to Suffolk County residents. They aim to stay on budget and on time for each and every project. “Their biggest strength is the quality of work,” says one client. Excellent communication was also a characteristic that was noted. This client subsequently hired the firm for other projects on his rental homes. Read more of general contractor Emily’s reviews and work.

Sweeten General Contractor Tara | Houston, TX

Build. Restore. Renovate. Those are the three words that sum up general contractor Tara’s construction firm’s offerings. As one of the women general contractors in our network, Tara and her partner have 50 years of experience combined.

Her projects are primarily in the Houston area working on commercial, residential, and multi-family homes. “We are small enough to listen and big enough to deliver,” says Tara. And her clients agree, often leaving five-star reviews. Read more on general contractor Tara’s reviews and work on her profile.

Sweeten General Contractor Cynthia | Chicago, IL

General contractor Cynthia works on all sorts of projects, ranging in budget levels. She works just as hard on the smaller jobs as she does on the whole-home renovations. She “doesn’t base [my] work on the dollar value,” says Cynthia.

She has also been in the position to fix past renovation mistakes. The client was so pleased with her work that he made her the preferred vendor for Hudson Homes in Bolingbrook, IL. “Everyone raves about her,” her client says. You’ll find more reviews and information about Cynthia’s work on her profile.

Sweeten General Contractor Neda | New York City

General contractor Neda’s company is known throughout the five boroughs for its expertise and refined skills in brownstone and multi-family house design. Principals in her firm are graduates from The Cooper Union, Pratt, and Princeton. This contractor has more than 20 years of experience in the construction business. She distinguishes herself from other firms through innovative design and high-quality craftsmanship.

Neda completed a townhouse renovation for Sweeten homeowners Kavi and David. Find more on general contractor Neda’s reviews and work on her profile.

Sweeten General Contractor Mordechay | Los Angeles

Specializing in single-home and room renovations, Sweeten contractor Mordechay and her partner, Ashley, provide services in Los Angeles and surrounding areas. They work to ensure each project is high-quality and fits the budget. The partners have been in our network since 2021. Mordechay’s goal is to complete each renovation with professionalism.

Her client Jacquelyn M. said, “Great people. Fair price.”  Read reviews and see more of general contractor Mordechay’s work.

Find a contractor

Sweeten General Contractor Doris | New Jersey

With 20 years of experience, contractor Doris, and her partner, Jazz, provide organized and quality work. They service Union, NJ, and surrounding areas and specialize in single and multi-family homes. Doris’s top priority is offering clients the highest level of service. She believes good communication achieves the results needed for each unique renovation.

Mujahid, a former client, said, “It went excellent. Very professional and knowledgeable person. Gives us updates very frequently. I would highly recommend them.” Read reviews and see more of general contractor Doris’s work.

Read The Women General Contractors of Sweeten, Part 1, Part 2, Part 3, and Part 4 of our series!

—

Are you an experienced general contractor in one of our locations? 

If you are, apply to be part of Sweeten’s general contractor network. Fill out our application here.

Sweeten handpicks the best general contractors to match each project’s location, budget, and scope, helping until project completion. Follow the blog for renovation ideas and inspiration and when you’re ready to renovate, start your renovation on Sweeten.
